{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.14883v1", "title": "Shock waves in classical dust collapse", "summary": "During gravitational collapse of dust in spherical symmetry, matter particles
may collide forming shell crossing surfaces (SCS) on which the Einstein
equations become indeterministic. We show that there is a unique evolution
beyond SCS such that a propagating shock wave forms, the metric remains
continuous, and the stress-energy tensor dynamically becomes that of a thin
shell. We give numerical simulations that exhibit this result.", "main_category": "gr-qc", "categories": "gr-qc", "published": "2025-04-21T06:23:12Z"}
